repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem: LSP completion kind lacks color and highlight group handling

Solution: Add kind generator with color preview and fallback highlight groups

comment_data.body: Why generate this for every completion request? It only needs to be constructed once.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -284,6 +304,7 @@ function M._lsp_to_complete_items(result, prefix, client_id)
   local candidates = {}
   local bufnr = api.nvim_get_current_buf()
   local user_convert = vim.tbl_get(buf_handles, bufnr, 'convert')
+  local kind_highlights = generate_kind_hlgroup()

comment_data.body: highlight group can be added or changed in runtime . i don't think this need generate once
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -284,6 +304,7 @@ function M._lsp_to_complete_items(result, prefix, client_id)
   local candidates = {}
   local bufnr = api.nvim_get_current_buf()
   local user_convert = vim.tbl_get(buf_handles, bufnr, 'convert')
+  local kind_highlights = generate_kind_hlgroup()

comment_data.body: You can still use an autocommand for tracking when the highlight groups have changed right?

comment_data.diff_hunk:

     eq(expected, result)
   end)
 
+  it('uses exists highlight group for kind', function()

comment_data.body: is this list meant to be exhaustive (i.e. does it need to cover ALL highlight group examples), or could it be reduced to cover various kinds of edge cases
only 25 in the spec. so can all be covered

What kind of server is providing the color codes in the document property?

I just tested this with the css server because I was curios how this looks like, but there the color codes are in the text:

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/06810116-0cb3-4158-a189-67312391877a)

No strong opinion on whether we should do this at all.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -244,6 +244,44 @@ local function match_item_by_value(value, prefix)
   return vim.startswith(value, prefix)
 end
 
+--- Generate the highlight group name for LSP completion item kind.
+--- Checks for the existence of specific highlight groups
+--- and returns the appropriate kind and kind_hlgroup
+---
+--- @param item lsp.CompletionItem
+--- @return string|nil, string|nil
+local function generate_kind(item)
+  local kind = lsp.protocol.CompletionItemKind[item.kind]
+  if not kind then
+    return
+  end
+
+  if item.kind == lsp.protocol.CompletionItemKind.Color then
+    local doc = get_doc(item)
+    if #doc > 0 then
+      local r, g, b = doc:match('rgb%((%d+)%s*,?%s*(%d+)%s*,?%s*(%d+)%)')
+      if r then
+        local color = string.format('%02x%02x%02x', tonumber(r), tonumber(g), tonumber(b))
+        local group = ('@lsp.color.%s'):format(color)
+        if vim.fn.hlID(group) < 1 then
+          api.nvim_set_hl(0, group, { fg = '#' .. color })
+        end
+        return '■', group
+      end
+    end

comment_data.body: from tailwindcss..seems like also can do some work on css. I remember vscode do it

comment_data.body: @mfussenegger  Several new highlight groups have been added here and temporarily placed in the lsp.type scope.. Any ideas?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -339,6 +339,16 @@ static const char *highlight_init_both[] = {
   "default link @lsp.type.typeParameter @type.definition",
   "default link @lsp.type.variable      @variable",
 
+  "default link @lsp.type.text          Pmenu",

comment_data.body: Note  that these are LSP semantic tokens, which are specified in the [specification](https://microsoft.github.io/language-server-protocol/specifications/lsp/3.17/specification/#textDocument_semanticTokens). We should _not_ invent new ones.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -339,6 +339,16 @@ static const char *highlight_init_both[] = {
   "default link @lsp.type.typeParameter @type.definition",
   "default link @lsp.type.variable      @variable",
 
+  "default link @lsp.type.text          Pmenu",

comment_data.body:
Use different names (and a different scheme that mirrors other "UI highlight groups") for those, e.g., `PmenuText` etc.

(They should also be added to `:h highlight-groups`.)
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -339,6 +339,16 @@ static const char *highlight_init_both[] = {
   "default link @lsp.type.typeParameter @type.definition",
   "default link @lsp.type.variable      @variable",
 
+  "default link @lsp.type.text          Pmenu",

comment_data.body: I  don't think `Pmenu` prefix is available,  these are two different things.  kind also in [spec](https://microsoft.github.io/language-server-protocol/specifications/lsp/3.17/specification/#completionItemKind)

comment_data.body: Yes, that's what I was asking. Personally, since there is a large overlap between these and I don't see much valid reason for giving them different colors where they coincide, I would prefer to have a single `kind` table with everything that is _either_ a `CompletionItemKind` or a `SymbolKind` (or both).

comment_regular_data.body:
What is the current behavior, and how does this change it? For example, is the current behavior that there is "no highlight", or "wrong highlight because of ..." ?

^ This is the general intention of the Problem description. Describe the symptom(s).

> What is the current behavior, and how does this change it? For example, is the current behavior that there is "no highlight", or "wrong highlight because of ..." ?
> 
> ^ This is the general intention of the Problem description. Describe the symptom(s).

Currently there is no highlight for the kind:

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/aeadcbc9-7b94-46b9-9bcb-d7d334b62b70)

With this change there would be:

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/490ac6d8-81dd-40c1-bdc4-ae6978865a63)

I kinda prefer without, but not opinionated enough about colors to make the call on this one.

> I kinda prefer without, but not opinionated enough about colors to make the call on this one.

Actually, these can be implemented in `convert`. Is it just provided out of the box? Or will we provide some completion configuration interface here in the future, `vim.completion.config` then adding a field to enable highlight group or not

repo.name: neovim

title: feat(lsp): add kind_hlgroup and color preview in completion
